conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C. Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
There are three starting points labeled A, B, and C at the top of the image.
There are two containers labeled D and E at the bottom of the image.
There are several baffles in the image: black, yellow, grey, pink, and green.
The black baffle is slanted downward to the right.
The yellow baffle is slanted downward to the left.
The grey baffle is slanted downward to the left.

premise: Liquid from A flows down along the black baffle.
conclusion: Liquid from A changes direction to the right due to the black baffle.

premise: Liquid from B flows down along the black baffle.
conclusion: Liquid from B changes direction to the right due to the black baffle.

premise: Liquid from A and B change direction to the right due to the black baffle.
conclusion: Liquid from A and B merge at the yellow baffle.

premise: Liquid from A and B merge at the yellow baffle.
conclusion: The merged stream from A and B is deflected to the left by the yellow baffle.

premise: Liquid from C flows directly downward.
conclusion: Liquid from C encounters the grey baffle and is deflected to the left.

premise: The merged stream from A and B is deflected to the left by the yellow baffle, and the stream from C is deflected to the left by the grey baffle.
conclusion: The merged stream from A and B flows into container E, and the stream from C flows into container D.
